Chapter on Entering the Inconceivable Liberation Realm and the Vows of Samantabhadra

At that time, the youth Sudhana entered the bodhisattvas' vast practices, contemplated with right mindfulness, his mind unobstructed, seeking the realm of the bodhisattvas' wisdom, seeing the bodhisattvas' supernormal powers, contemplating the bodhisattvas' supreme merits, donning the bodhisattvas' firm armor of progress, giving rise to the bodhisattvas' great joy, heading towards the bodhisattvas' inconceivability, roaming in the bodhisattvas' great freedom, cultivating the bodhisattvas' ground of merit, observing the bodhisattvas' ground of samÄdhi, abiding in the bodhisattvas' ground of dhÄraá¹‡Ä«, perfecting the bodhisattvas' ground of great vows, attaining the bodhisattvas' ground of eloquence, and accomplishing the bodhisattvas' ground of powers.
Gradually proceeding forward, he arrived at that city, searching for where MahÄdeva was now.
People all told him:
In this city, manifesting a vast body, sitting on a high and prominent seat, expounding the Dharma for the assembly.
Having heard this, Sudhana went to his place, bowed his head at his feet, stood with palms joined, and said:
Holy One!
I have already given rise to the mind of supreme, perfect enlightenment, but I do not yet know how bodhisattvas learn the bodhisattva practices and cultivate the bodhisattva path;
I have heard that the holy one is well able to instruct, and I wish that you would explain it for me.
At that time, the great god then extended his four arms, took the four ocean waters, washed his face, and held various golden flowers to scatter over Sudhana. He said to him:
Good man!
It is extremely rare!
You are able to seek spiritual friends in this way.
Good man!
All bodhisattvas appearing in the world are extremely rare, difficult to hear, difficult to see, like a lotus flower among sentient beings, a refuge and savior in difficult and dangerous places;
Like a city of peace and security creating great light in dark places, like the bright sun;
Also like a guide leading sentient beings to enter the gate of the Buddha's teachings, and like a valiant general skillfully guarding the city of omniscience.
Good man!
Bodhisattvas are like this, difficult to encounter, only with pure body, speech, and mind, without faults, can one then see their form, hear their eloquence, and always be present at all times.
Good man!
I have already accomplished the bodhisattva liberation called 'cloud net.'
Sudhana said:
Sage!
What is the realm of the cloud net liberation?

At that time, the great god manifested in front of Sudhana various heaps of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, mother-of-pearl, agate, maá¹‡i jewels, heaps of the store of impurity, vaiá¸Å«rya jewels, jewels manifesting the ten directions, heaps of jeweled crowns, jeweled seals, jeweled garlands, jeweled earrings, jeweled bracelets, jeweled locks, jeweled bells, jeweled necklaces, jeweled pearl nets, heaps of maá¹‡i jewels of various colors, heaps of various adornments of all jewels, heaps of various wish-fulfilling maá¹‡i jewels, each heap as large as a mountain.

He also manifested all kinds of flowers, all kinds of incense, all kinds of garlands, all kinds of canopies, all kinds of banners, all kinds of flags, all kinds of ointments, all kinds of powders, all kinds of clothing, all kinds of music, and all kinds of five sense pleasures, also like piled up mountains, and manifested countless hundreds of thousands of myriads of koá¹­is of young women.
Then that great god said to Sudhana:
Good man!

Now, indulge your mind and take these things to make offerings to the TathÄgatas, cultivate all kinds of merit and virtue, and give them to all, in order to guide sentient beings and demonstrate the difficulty of giving up while being able to give up, causing them to cultivate the perfection of giving.
Good man!

Just as I have manifested this object for you, teaching you to practice giving, and so on, I do the same for all sentient beings, causing them all to be perfumed by the power of the roots of goodness of this giving, causing them to extinguish the superior mind of obstacles to giving, and to respectfully make offerings to the most excellent field of blessings of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, and to good and virtuous friends, to increase good dharmas, and to give rise to the mind of supreme, perfect enlightenment.
Furthermore, good sons!
If there are sentient beings who are attached to the five desires and are self-indulgent, I manifest impure realms for them.
Why is this?
Because those sentient beings are foolish and deluded, their minds are confused and intoxicated by the colors of women, just like infants who have no self-nature;
They are also like white clothes that easily take on the colors of dye, drowning in desire and unable to escape;
Like worms in excrement who take pleasure in staying in excrement;
Like a filthy pig adorning its body with filth;
Like a criminal bound in various ways;
Like a world-robbing thief always stealing the wealth of the Dharma;
Like a criminal sentenced to death being handed over to the executioner;
Like a blind person leading a blind person, both falling into a dangerous pit;
Like a boat on the ocean encountering a violent storm, damaging the roots of goodness and losing all the treasures of the Dharma;
Like being near a poisonous dragon, the poisonous air contaminating one, forever losing the fragrance of precepts and injuring the life of wisdom.

To put it simply, foolish infants are blinded by desire, bound by desire, controlled by desire, deluded by desire, always following the mind of desire as their servant, always turning with desire like a calf following its mother, bound by desire and unable to be free.
Good man!
I have compassion for these blind beings and use skillful means to rescue them.
First, I manifest an attractive and lovable female body to please their minds, causing them to become attached;
He also manifested death, his body decaying and rotting, being eaten by various birds and beasts, various impurities like a charnel ground;

He also manifested the terrifying form of a rakshasa woman, with a body like black clouds, hair as red as cinnabar, a large belly hanging down, canine teeth protruding upwards, adorned with human skulls, holding a sharp sword, emitting a great evil sound.
He manifested such a body to those who were attached to desire, causing them to give rise to disgust and loathing, their minds filled with terror.

Because of this, they gave rise to the wish to see me. I should take on their form and speak the Dharma for them, causing them to eliminate disgust and fear, to abide in the body of precepts, to accomplish the supreme perfection of precepts, to be endowed with the ten perfections, and to perfect the supreme fruit of enlightenment.
At that time, the great god praised the perfection of precepts for Sudhana in various ways and spoke a verse, saying:ğŸ”½Just as all sentient beings and plants and trees
All grow relying on the earth,
All the wholesome roots, mundane and supramundane, are all based on the supreme ground of morality.
Without morality, wishing to be reborn in a good realm of existence is like a bird without wings trying to fly in the sky,
like a person without feet trying to walk, or like trying to cross the ocean without a boat or raft.
Like the ascetics who eat roots and fruits, drink water to sustain themselves, and live in the mountains and forests,
or wearing tree bark like animals, without morality one cannot attain purity.
Some shave the four sides but leave hair on the crown, or do not wash the hair and twist it into a topknot,
some go naked or wear strange clothes, these are all like play without morality,
some bathe in icy rivers, or throw themselves into blazing fires,
some climb high mountains and throw themselves off, these are all in vain deaths without morality.
Some bathe in lotus ponds or in the water of eloquence, or always drink and bathe in the Ganges River,
Seeking blessings day and night as a support, these have no precepts and are empty and fruitless.
Perhaps bathing three times a day and evening, or performing homa three times,
Refusing grains and remaining silent like a dumb sheep, having no precepts and harming the body is of no benefit.
Desiring to dwell in the heavenly palace until the end of the heavenly lifespan, wearing heavenly ornaments to adorn the body,
Eating and drinking the finest flavors in the heavens, upholding the precepts is all completely fulfilled.
Whether of a great clan or a candÄla class, both can uphold the precepts and be reborn in the heavens,

Noble or humble, class or caste, violating the precepts the body falls into the hells without distinction.ğŸ”½The humble upholding the precepts are reborn in the heavens, the noble violating the precepts fall into the dark prisons,
MÄtaá¹…ga upholding the precepts is also reborn in the heavens, the sages violating the precepts enter the various hells.
The royal clan with much learning, endowed with strength and vigor, with evil views and no precepts like a venomous beast,
Like a sweet fruit tree surrounded by fierce beasts, or like a lotus pond with poisonous snakes dwelling in it.
It is better to keep to poverty and lowliness, always upholding the precepts, possessing the noble wealth and virtues that adorn the body,
The one who breaks the precepts is despised by the multitude, while the one who upholds the precepts is trusted and respected by gods and humans.
Sandalwood, saffron, and agarwood, all of these are not considered fragrant.
The supreme fragrance of the bodhisattva's precepts pervades the human and heavenly realms without end,
The lowly one who upholds the precepts is reborn in the heavens, and in the present life is revered by the king,
The happiness and peace of this world and the next life, such are the fruits of the precepts taught by the Sage.
If one wishes to be born among humans, gods, or in nirvana, one must fully uphold the precepts as appropriate and will certainly attain them,
Therefore, diligently uphold the pure precepts, and all wishes will be fulfilled according to one's mind.
If one is at the point of death with pain in the limbs and joints, and all relatives wish to part,
Carefully contemplate that I have pure precepts, with a joyful and worry-free mind and body.
Precepts are the supreme medicine for the illness of afflictions, protecting from all suffering and misfortune like parents,
A lamp in the darkness, a bridge in the cycle of birth and death, a boat and raft in the boundless sea of karma.
Indra, the universal monarch, the lord of majestic virtue, wealthy, noble, and majestic, incomparable,
If one has servants at home who can uphold the precepts, they will serve and make offerings with reverence and respect.
If one is about to reach the end of life, whether upholding or breaking the precepts, one will give rise to fear,
If one wishes to attain the utmost bliss in the future, one should single-mindedly strive to uphold the precepts.
The precept-jewel does not need the protection of weapons and soldiers, the precepts are a hidden treasure that cannot be invaded,
The precepts are a courageous companion that leads the way, the precepts are the adornments for transcending the world.
I praise the merits of upholding the precepts, just as the Buddha, the World-Honored One, truly spoke,
In order to awaken those who break the precepts, causing their minds to firmly abide in pure precepts.
Good man!

Just as I use these various skillful means to teach and transform sentient beings, causing them to abide in the perfection of pure precepts,ğŸ”½if there are sentient beings with anger, arrogance, and much contention, I use powerful means to subdue their minds, manifesting extremely frightening forms such as rÄká¹£asas who drink blood and eat flesh, causing them to see and become frightened, their minds and intentions becoming gentle, and they abandon grudges and resentment.

If there are sentient beings who are confused, lazy, and negligent, I manifest for them kings, thieves, water, fire, and various serious illnesses and perilous difficulties, causing them to see and become alarmed, knowing there is worry and suffering, becoming disgusted with confusion and negligence, and encouraging themselves to be diligent day and night.

Using such various skillful means, I enable them to abandon all unwholesome dharmas, cultivate all pure wholesome dharmas, eliminate all obstacles to the perfections, open the doors to all perfections, transcend all perilous paths of obstacles, and reach all unobstructed places.
Good man!

I only attain this bodhisattva liberation of the cloud net. As for the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, they are like Åšakra, who can destroy the asura armies of all afflictions; like the waters of the great ocean, which can extinguish the fires of all beings' afflictions; like the fire at the end of the eon, which can completely dry up all beings' waters of craving; like a great fierce wind, which can completely blow apart the banners of all beings' views of grasping; like vajra, which can completely shatter the mountains of all beings' views of self;
how could I know or speak of their practices of merit and virtue?
Good man!

In the Bodhimanda of Magadha in this Jambudvipa, there is a local deity named Self-Nature Unmoving. You should go ask her how a bodhisattva practices bodhisattva conduct and cultivates the bodhisattva path.
Then, the youth Sudhana paid homage at the feet of the great god, circumambulated him innumerable times, single-mindedly gazing up at him, and then took his leave.

At that time, the youth Sudhana, receiving the instructions of the celestial spirit, gradually proceeded to the northeast, heading towards the great path and maá¹‡á¸ala site of the Bodhi Tree in the country of Magadha, and was about to go to the place of the local deity Self-Nature Unmoving.
Ten thousand earth deities were together in that place, and they said to each other:

This coming youth is the treasure of all tathÄgatas. He will certainly become the reliance for all sentient beings. He will certainly completely destroy the eggshell of ignorance of all sentient beings.

You will hold the vajra sword of the bodhisattva's wisdom, be courageous and self-assured, attain fearlessness in the Dharma, and subdue all the heterodox theories of non-Buddhists;
You will use the ship of the Dharma in the ocean of birth and death to ferry sentient beings and enable them to reach the other shore.
Your wisdom and understanding will be perfect, like the full moon, and you will surely extinguish the heat and agitation in the minds of all sentient beings.

At that time, the earth spirits such as the immovable self-nature, in a group of ten thousand, used their spiritual powers to shake the great earth, emit thunderous roars, and emit great light illuminating the trichiliocosm.

Various treasures adorned everywhere, their reflections flowing with light, interpenetrating each other. Then, the Earth Goddess told Sudhana:

You have planted good roots here before. I will show them to you. Do you wish to see them?
At that time, Sudhana bowed at the feet of the Earth Goddess, circumambulated her countless times, and stood with palms joined, saying:

I have attained the bodhisattva liberation called the treasury of invincible wisdom. I always use this teaching to fully perfect and mature sentient beings.

I remember since the time of DÄ«paá¹ƒkara Buddha, I have always followed the bodhisattva, respectfully guarding him like a shadow follows a form.

thoroughly seeking and deeply entering into all the bodhisattva's vows and the realm of wisdom, fulfilling the bodhisattva's
All the pure practices cultivated, contemplating the bodhisattvas' various samÄdhis, following
, penetrating, and abiding in the bodhisattvas' various Dharma doors, ultimately understanding all the
natures of the mind, perfecting all the great sovereign powers, increasing all indestructible dharmas,
going everywhere to all the buddha-lands, universally receiving the predictions of all the tathÄgatas, recollecting
and presently realizing the nature of omniscience, turning the wheel of the Dharma of all the buddhas, extensively expounding
all the sÅ«tra teachings, the great Dharma light illuminating everywhere, teaching and transforming all
sentient beings, manifesting all the buddhas' spiritual transformations, following and understanding, upholding and recollecting,
always without forgetting.

Good man!
Ever since then, in this Dharma door, entering and exiting, cultivating and increasing, I always see the Buddhas, never leaving them.

Starting from the initial attainment, up to the Worthy Kalpa, in between, I encountered Buddhas as numerous as the dust particles in an inexpressibly inexpressible number of Buddha lands, all of whom I served, respected, and made offerings to.
I also saw those Buddhas going to the Bodhi tree and sitting in the place of enlightenment, manifesting great spiritual powers and various Buddha activities;
I also saw all the merits and wholesome roots of those Buddhas.

I only know this liberation door of the treasury of invincible wisdom;

Just as the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are always able to attend to all buddhas, able to uphold all the teachings spoken by the buddhas, able to enter the profound wisdom of all buddhas, moment by moment filling all dharma realms, equal to the body of the TathÄgata, giving rise to the mind of the buddhas, endowed with the qualities of the buddhas, performing the activities of the buddhas, moment by moment giving rise to the pure treasury of teachings of all buddhas, free from discriminating thoughts, always without interruption, how could I know or speak of their meritorious practices?
Good man!
To the north of the Ganges River in Magadha country in this JambudvÄ«pa, there is a great city called Kapilavastu. There is a night spirit named Vasanta.

At that time, the youth Sudhana, instructed by the earth spirit, single-mindedly contemplated and remembered the bodhisattva's liberation gate of the treasury of unyielding wisdom. When he encountered sunset, he contemplated in accordance with the practices of the bodhisattvas, yearning to see the night spirit Vasanta, and towards the good and wise advisor, he gave rise to the thought of the TathÄgata.
He further thought:
By means of the good and wise advisor, one attains the all-pervading eye, and is able to clearly see the realms of the ten directions;
By means of the good and wise advisor, one attains the vast understanding, and is able to thoroughly comprehend all objects of cognition;
by the spiritual benefactors I have attained the eye of samÄdhi, able to observe all the teachings of the Dharma;
by the spiritual benefactors I have attained the eye of wisdom, able to illuminate the oceans of lands in the ten directions.
As she had these thoughts, she saw the night spirit in the sky, in a pavilion of various colored jewels and maá¹‡i jewels, on a lion throne of fragrant lotus flowers and treasures;

She was adorned with various jeweled necklaces, wore red robes, and on her head she wore a brahma crown, with all the stars shining on her body.
In each pore of her body appeared the sentient beings of countless worlds who were about to fall into the evil destinies, and she caused them all to avoid the evil destinies and attain liberation.

These sentient beings, whether born among humans, born in the heavens, or heading towards the enlightenment of the two vehicles, or practicing the path of omniscience, such images are vividly manifested.
Moreover, in each and every pore, various methods of teaching and transforming are manifested to mature sentient beings:

Sometimes manifesting a body with various appearances, sometimes speaking the Dharma with various languages, sometimes manifesting the path of the Å›rÄvaka vehicle, sometimes manifesting the path of the pratyekabuddha vehicle, sometimes manifesting the practices of all bodhisattvas:

The courage of bodhisattvas, the samÄdhi of bodhisattvas, the mastery of bodhisattvas, the abode of bodhisattvas, the contemplation of bodhisattvas, the thought of bodhisattvas, the supernormal powers of bodhisattvas, the realm of bodhisattvas, the lion's roar of bodhisattvas, the liberation and play of bodhisattvas, in this way various methods mature sentient beings.

Having seen and heard this, the mind of Sudhana the youth was greatly delighted, jumping and rejoicing, his wishes fulfilled, loving and respecting, throwing his body to the ground, bowing at the feet of the night spirit, circumambulating countless times, and then in front [of her] with palms joined, he said these words:
Holy One!

I have already given rise to the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment. Then, that night spirit said to Sudhana:ğŸ”½Excellent!ğŸ”½Excellent!

You are able to deeply respect the spiritual benefactors, and the power of the Dharma and the power of the sages enter your body, causing you to diligently seek, not sparing your body or life, to single-mindedly draw near, delight in hearing their words, and listen and practice in accordance with their teachings;
Because you draw near, hear the teachings, and practice with a determined mind, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

I have attained the bodhisattva's liberation door of teaching and taming, which destroys the darkness of all beings' ignorance and illuminates the Dharma.
Good man!

I give rise to a mind of great compassion for sentient beings with unwholesome actions, a mind of joy for sentient beings who practice good dharmas, a non-dual mind for sentient beings who engage in both good and evil conduct, a mind to cause the arising of purity for defiled sentient beings, a mind to cause the arising of right practice for sentient beings who engage in wrong practice, a mind to cause the arising of great understanding for sentient beings with inferior understanding, a mind to cause the arising of diligence for lazy sentient beings, a mind to cause the abandonment of cyclic existence for sentient beings who delight in birth and death, and a mind to cause the abiding in omniscience for sentient beings who abide in the path of the two vehicles.
Good man!
Because I have attained this liberation gate, I am always in accord with such a mind.
Good man!

When it is dark at night, when ghosts, spirits, thieves, and other evil beings are roaming about, when thick clouds, heavy fog, violent winds, torrential rains, and eclipses of the sun, moon, and stars obscure all forms, I see sentient beings who have entered the ocean, who are traveling on land, in mountains, forests, wildernesses, deserts, and dangerous places;

who may have encountered thieves, who may be lacking provisions, who may be confused about directions, or who may have forgotten the way and are unable to escape on their own, in panic and fear. At that time, I use various skillful means to rescue them. For those in danger at sea, I manifest as a ship captain, a fish king, a horse king, a turtle king, an elephant king, an asura king, and as the ocean deity and the form of a fisherman, to rescue those sentient beings in various sea dangers.
Namely:

Stopping bad winds and rain, and calming great waves, in whirlpools and in places of confusion, leading their paths and showing them islands and shores, enabling them to escape fear and all attain peace and security.
And they further think:
'With this wholesome root, I dedicate it to giving to sentient beings, wishing for them to abandon all suffering.'
For all sentient beings on land who encounter fear in the darkness of night:

In places of gravel, thorns, tigers, leopards, jackals, wolves, lions, vicious beasts, poisonous snakes, dangerous paths, robbers, and ghosts and spirits running amok, they manifest as the sun, moon, and stars, as morning glow and evening lightning, various kinds of light, sometimes as houses, sometimes as the multitudes of people, the devas, nÄgas, eight groups, bodhisattvas, and tathÄgatas, various forms and appearances, guiding and protecting them, enabling them to escape the calamities of fear.
And they further think:
'May I dedicate this wholesome root to all sentient beings, enabling them to extinguish all the darkness of afflictions.'

All sentient beings cherish their lives, love their fame, crave for wealth and treasures, value official positions, cling to their children and women, and are entangled in the dense forest of wives and relatives. They have various bonds and many worries and fears due to not getting what they seek. I will save them all and free them from suffering.

For those traveling in mountains, dangerous paths, and dense forests, I will become a good spirit, manifest a close form, become a beautiful bird, comfort them with sounds, become a spiritual medicine, radiate light to illuminate, show them fruit trees, show them springs and wells, show the correct path, show the flat land, sometimes manifest a cave, sometimes manifest a superior dwelling, enabling them to escape all worries and sufferings.

For those traveling in the wilderness, dangerous paths, dense forests, where poisonous trees, vines, and rattan intertwine and conceal, where the jana-ra beast lurks and injures, and roars out frightening sounds that startle the listeners;

Falling into these difficulties, with various worries and fears, obscured by clouds and fog, the mind confused, frightened by various things, manifesting a powerful body to rescue from danger, showing the right path, causing them to escape, thinking like this:

'May all sentient beings cut down the thickets of views, sever the net of craving, escape from the wilderness of birth and death, extinguish the darkness of afflictions, enter the fearless great city of omniscience, reach the level ground, and ultimately attain peace and happiness.'
Good man!

If there are sentient beings who fight in cities and towns, even small animals who are always contentious, I use skillful means to cause them to reconcile, each giving rise to a compassionate mind, forever ending their disputes.
Thinking like this:
'May all sentient beings be free from the disputes of afflictions and attain the harmony of the Dharma.'
Good man!

If there are sentient beings who delight in and cling to their lands, striving for victory and defeat, causing various disputes and suffering, I use skillful means to make them abandon their attachments, manifest impermanence, and give rise to revulsion.
Thinking like this:
'May all sentient beings not cling to the aggregates, but abide in the realm of omniscience of all Buddhas.'
Good man!

If there are sentient beings who delight in and cling to villages, crave for houses, always dwell in darkness, willingly submit to bondage, and undergo various sufferings, I will teach them the Dharma to make them give rise to revulsion, to fulfill the Dharma, and to abide in dependence on the Dharma.
Thinking like this:
'May all sentient beings not crave or delight in the six sense bases, may they quickly escape from the realm of birth and death, and ultimately abide in the city of omniscience.'
Good man!
If there are sentient beings who walk in the darkness of night, confused about the ten directions;

On level roads, they think of them as dangerous, and on dangerous paths, they think of them as level. They take the high as low and the low as high, their minds confused, giving rise to great suffering and distress. I use skillful means to extend light and illuminate them.
If they wish to leave, I show them the doors;
if they wish to go, I show them the roads;
if they wish to cross to the other shore, I show them the bridges;
if they wish to cross rivers and seas, I give them boats and rafts.ğŸ”½If it is hot, I show them coolness;
if it is cold, I show them warmth;
warm palaces and cool pavilions are suitable to the season and pleasing to the mind.
If they wish to go sightseeing, I always lead them in front, showing them the dangerous and easy, safe and perilous places;
if they wish to rest, I show them the nearby cities and houses, allowing them to rest;

for those traveling far who are thirsty and exhausted, I show them ponds, rivers, streams, and springs for them to drink and bathe, and flower forests and fruit trees, allowing them to cool off and attain physical and mental peace and joy.
If there are parents, spouses, children, and relatives who are separated by affection, they will be reunited without any suffering or distress.
They think like this:
Just as I illuminate and remove the darkness of the night here, saving from various calamities and misfortunes, and enabling all worldly affairs to be proclaimed and narrated;

I wish that I may universally illuminate with the light of wisdom the long night of birth and death and the place of ignorance for all sentient beings, who lack the eye of wisdom, are covered by the inversions of conceptual thoughts and views, have the notion of permanence in impermanence, the notion of happiness in suffering, the notion of self in non-self, and the notion of purity in impurity;
They firmly cling to the notions of self, person, sentient being, aggregates, elements, and sense fields;
They are confused about cause and effect, do not understand good and evil, kill sentient beings, and even hold wrong views;
They are not filial to their parents, do not respect Å›ramaá¹‡as and brÄhmaá¹‡as;
They do not know bad people, do not recognize good people;
They are attached to evil things, dwell in wrong teachings;
Slandering the TathÄgatas and destroying the wheel of the true Dharma;
Disparaging and harming the bodhisattvas, slighting the path of the Great Vehicle, and cutting off the mind of enlightenment;
Repaying those who have been kind with harm, and always harboring resentment towards those who have not been kind;
Slandering the sages and associating with evil companions;
